title: Pathankot Terror Attack: Indian Air Force Briefs Media About the Ongoing Operation
description:
Pathankot Terror Attack: Indian Air Force briefs media about the ongoing operation.

Till now seven Jawans of India including Subedar Fateh Singh, Gursewak Singh and Lieutenant Colonel Niranjan Kumar have lost their lives in an operation in Pathankot. 

Defense Minister Manohar Parrikar meets Prime Minister Narendra Modi and briefs him about the attack. An attack helicopter was seen opening firing inside the Pathankot Air Force station.

Four terrorists killed in terror attack at Pathankot Air Force Station in Punjab. Pathankot is a key air base for MiG-21 Bison fighters and Mi-35 attack helicopters, located 50 kilometers from Indo-Pak border. The suspected terrorists belong to Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror outfit.

title: Parvez Sagar - Aaj Tak - Main accused of Uri Attack is Masood Azhar
description:
Mr. Parvez Sagar is eminent TV Journalist and social activist of India. He is national media excellence award winner journalist. In year 1997 commenced his journalism career after getting associated with a national daily news paper and after the completion of graduation, got involved with journalism thoroughly.

He served to print media for a long span of approximately 5 years. He stared his TV career with ETV. After worked one of the India’s best news channel Aaj Tak for 4.5 years, He worked with CNEB News Channel, CNN, ZEE News, Mahuaa News and Bhaskar. Currently he is associated with India Today Group / Aaj Tak as Assistant Editor.

Mr. Parvez Sagar is the founder of well known Indian non-profit organisation Smart Education & Welfare Association® SEWA and Parvez Sagar Foundation, India. These both organisations working for Education, Women Empowerment and Child rights in North India. They are running a free education center for poor and labor class children at Saharanpur city of UP.

Mr. Parvez sagar is honoured by Many Media & Cultural organizations for Excellence work in the field of News Media and for his social efforts. 

Follow them on- 
www.facebook.com/parvezsagarfc

title: Surgical Strike: 150 Para Commandos Killed 35 Militants in 90 Minutes in PoK at LoC
description:
Surgical Strike by India:150 commandos, 90 minutes, 35 militants killed. Watch how Indian army's Para military commandos conducted a surgical strike in Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) and killed 38 terrorists and two rangers of Pakistan. 150 para commandos landed from helicopter near border and entered in PoK.
In a press conference army DGMO tells that Indian army's para commandos conducted surgical strike in Pakistan's PoK. Indian army destroyed the terror launch pads and killed 38 terrorists.
This is how PM Modi take revenge of Uri attack in Jammu and Kashmir. 
NSA Ajit Doval, Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar and army chief were monitoring the whole surgical strike operation.

description:

title: One Month On: The Demonetisation Dialogue
description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi's dramatic move to scrap 500 and 1,000 rupee notes in a bid to curb corruption and black money completed one month this week. The Prime Minister has thanked people for their support to the 'yagna' against corruption, black money and terrorism and asked the youth to be the agents of change for the country. However, the other reality is also that of long queues continuing one month later, cash rationing and deaths in queues. What is the big picture for India as a country now? BJP's Arvind Gupta; BJD MP Kalikesh Singh Deo; Swaraj Abhiyan Co-founder Yogendra Yadav; AAP Spokesperson Raghav Chaddha; and Shaurya Doval from India Foundation join a discussion on the big picture of demonetisation.

Watch full video: http://www.ndtv.com/video/shows/the-ndtv-dialogues/one-month-on-the-demonetisation-dialogue-442104?yt

title: 7@7 : Pakistan Prepares For Worst Expecting Strike From India After Uri Attack
description:

title: Rs. 2,000 Notes In ATMs From Today Or Tomorrow, Says Government
description:
New Rs. 2,000 notes will be available in ATMs from today or tomorrow, the government announced today amid a nationwide scramble for cash. Old Rs. 500 and Rs. 1,000 notes, scrapped last week in a sudden announcement by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will be accepted at government hospitals, petrol stations, private nursing homes and as bills and toll fee for 10 more days.

description:

Enjoy listening to this melodious song compilation named Memorable Bangla Songs which includes songs like Aro Aro Prabhu, Charano Dharite, Ektuku, Tui Fele, Ebar Tor, Bipulo Tarango, Jo Tomay, Mamo, Mone Ki etc. 

Rabindranath Tagore, a famous Bengali poet, is known to have reshaped Bengali literature and music as well as Indian art. He was author of Geetanjali and became the first non-European to win the Nobel Prize in Literature for the same in 1913. He was a prolific composer with over 2000 songs to his credit, generally known as Rabindra Sangeet. Sutra Geetanjali, a part of Rabindra Sangeet, is a song compilation of selected songs written by Rabindranath Tagore. These meaningful songs come up with suitable narration as well.

title: Pathankot attack: The blame game begins
description:
All six terrorists involved in the Pathankot air base attack have been killed, four days after it first began. Pakistan Prime Minister called PM Modi and assured him of full support in the terror investigations. Even though no Indian official has said so, a Pakistan foreign ministry statement late Monday night said India had shared information regarding the attack. Security forces are still combing the area to clear the base of explosives, but as the dust settles, questions over security lapses are mounting - the Gurdaspur Superintendent of Police whose car was hijacked is being debriefed, but where does the buck stop when it comes to responsibility for delayed responses to the first security alert on New Year's eve?

title: Indira Gandhi Ignored Advice To Demonetise, Sold Out India: PM Modi
description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi today levelled charges against two former premiers, his predecessor Dr Manmohan Singh and Indira Gandhi, of ignoring basic steps to fight corruption. Obvious and recommended methods include demonetisation, he told his party's parliamentarians this morning, at a time when his government is being asked to explain the vast cash crunch forged by its sudden cancellation of 500-and 1,000-rupee notes a little over a month ago. The Prime Minister's address to his party lawmakers were made on the last day of this session of Parliament which accomplished close to nothing because of daily disruptions over the demonetisation drive.

title: Pathankot Terror Attack: Know How Militants Get Indian Army Uniform
description:
Watch India TV's special report to know how militants get Indian Army uniform before attacking at Pathankot Air base and Gurdaspur terror attack. 

Till now seven Jawans of India including Subedar Fateh Singh, Gursewak Singh and Lieutenant Colonel Niranjan Kumar have lost their live in combating operation in Pathankot. 

Defense Minister Manohar Parrikar meets Prime Minister Narendra Modi and briefs him about the attack. An attack helicopter was seen opening firing inside the Pathankot Air Force station.

Four terrorists killed in terror attack at Pathankot Air Force Station in Punjab. Pathankot is a key air base for MiG-21 Bison fighters and Mi-35 attack helicopters, located 50 kilometers from Indo-Pak border. The suspected terrorists belong to Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror outfit.

title: Cash Clean Up: Is Government's Move Going To Work?
description:
It has now been a week since Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the end of 500 and 1,000 rupee notes. Seven days later, there is still chaos in many parts of the country as people line up for cash and ATMs run dry. Today, the government announced that banks will now pul indelible Ink on fingers of those who come to change their old notes - that is to avoid repeat trips to the bank for currency exchange. As the Centre tries to deal with the enormous task, the Opposition is all set to take them on in the Parliament tomorrow. Mamata Banerjee, who is going to march to the President's House tomorrow, has got BJP's ally, the Shiv Sena, on board. Even the Supreme Court has said that the common man shouldn't suffer. So is this cash clean-up going to work in the long run?

title: Take Public Stand On Terror If You Live & Work In India: Chetan Bhagat On Pakistani Actors
description:
Amid escalating tension with Pakistan, India's Motion Picture Producers Association has passed a resolution to ban Pakistani actors from the Indian film and television industry. On NDTV's Townhall, author and film producer Chetan Bhagat says he doesn't believe Pakistani actors should be sent back, but that 'they need to make their stand on terror clear' to their fans. He added that the world needs to know that 'Pakistan is inflicting terror' on India and that their own actors need to condemn terror acts if they earn their living in India.

Salil Chowdhury was an Indian music composer, who mainly composed for Bengali, Hindi, and Malayalam films. He was also a poet and a playwright. He is affectionately called Salilda by his admirers.His musical ability was widely recognized and acknowledged in the Indian film industry. He was an accomplished arranger and was proficient in several musical instruments, including flute, the piano, and the esraj. He was also widely acclaimed and admired for his inspirational and original poetry.

title: Dastak: Nagrota Attack: Two Army Officers and Five Jawans Martyred
description:

According to reports, a group of militants armed with automatic weapons and explosives, entered the field regiment camp dressed in police uniform around 5.40 am.Â  They started firing indiscriminately at the Officers' Mess inside the camp in Nagrota, some 15 km from here.

description:

All banks and post offices will open on November 11 and people can exchange their old banned Rs 500 and Rs 1000 currency notes worth upto four thousand rupees. Upto ten thousand rupees can be withdraw from the ATMs. There is no limit to submit the cash in banks. ATMs will be closed till 11th November.
Modi government has banned Rs 500 and Rs 1000 notes to curb black money, terrorism, naxalism, drug menace, inflation and fake currency.

title: Best of Nazrul Geeti by Dhirendra Chandra Mitra | Bengali Songs of Kazi Nazrul Islam
description:
Presenting a compilation of Nazrul Geeti or Songs of Nazrul that showcases some of the rare Bengali Songs written by Nazrul in the form of Shyama Sangeet and other Hindu devotional song format. Kazi Nazrul Islam the name requires no introduction. The national poet of Bangladesh earned the title of “Rebel Poet” for his fiery revolutionary writings. He was also a Bengali polymath, poet, writer, musician and revolutionary. Popularly known as Nazrul, his poetry and music espoused Indo-Islamic renaissance and intense spiritual rebellion against fascism and oppression. Nazrul's writings explore themes such as love, freedom, and revolution; he opposed all bigotry, including religion and gender. Throughout his career, Nazrul wrote short stories, novels, and essays but is best known for his poems, in which he pioneered new forms such as Bengali ghazals. Nazrul wrote and composed music for his nearly 4,000 songs (including gramophone records), collectively known as Nazrul geeti (Songs of Nazrul), which are widely popular today. In what his contemporaries regarded as one of his greatest flairs of creativity, Nazrul began composing the very first ghazals in Bengali, transforming a form of poetry written mainly in Persian and Urdu. Nazrul became the first person to introduce Islam into the larger mainstream tradition of Bengali music. The first record of Islamic songs by Nazrul Islam was a commercial success and many gramophone companies showed interest in producing these. A significant impact of Nazrul was that it drew made Muslims more comfortable in the Bengali Arts, which used to be dominated by Hindus. Nazrul also composed a number of notable Shamasangeet, Bhajan and Kirtan, combining Hindu devotional music. Arousing controversy and passions in his readers, Nazrul's ideas attained great popularity across India. In 1928, Nazrul began working as a lyricist, composer and music director for His Master's Voice Gramophone Company. The songs written and music composed by him were broadcast on radio stations across the country. He was also enlisted/attached with the Indian Broadcasting Company.

All songs compiled here are sung by the legendary Nazrul Geeti artist Shri Dhirendra Chandra Mitra. The soulful voice and melodious renditions of popular Nazrul Geeti like Shashaney Jagichhey Shyama and Brojo Gopi Khele Hori are a real treat that this compilation offers to a listener.

== Album Song Data ==
All songs sung by Dhirendra Chandra Mitra
All Lyrics & Compositions: Kazi Nazrul Islam

► Puhler Jalshay Nirab Keno 0:00:05
► Shashaney Jagichhey Shyama 0:03:17
► Bhorer Jhiler Jaley 0:06:44
► Chaitali Chandini 0:09:47
► Kajri Gahiya Esho 0:13:03
► Ajo Kandey Kananey 0:16:45 
► Brojo Gopi Khele Hori 0:19:31

title: They came back to kill me, I'm innocent, says cop abducted in Pathankot
description:
At the heart of decoding the many lapses that allowed a huge attack on the Pathankot air force base is a senior police officer who was abducted by the terrorists that are believed to have come from Pakistan. On the night of December 31, Police Superintendent Salwinder Singh was travelling with two other men following a visit to a shrine near the border with Pakistan. He was not in uniform, but was using his official car which was not, at the time, using the beacon that gives it the right of way in traffic. "They were armed with AK-47s and spoke in Punjabi, Hindi and Urdu," said Mr Singh to NDTV, amid reports of inconsistencies in his account shared with central investigators, by whom he was interrogated for six hours yesterday.

title: Can Deposit Old Notes Worth 5,000-Plus Only Once Till Dec 30: Government
description:
The government has in new restrictions said that deposits of more than 5,000 rupees in old 500 and 1,000-rupee notes can be made in a bank account only once from now till December 30, the deadline for depositing old notes. The Reserve Bank of India or RBI has also said more than Rs. 5,000 in old notes will be credited into accounts only after customers have given a "satisfactory explanation" to two officials on why they had not deposited old notes earlier.  Prime Minister Narendra Modi had on November 8 suddenly abolished Rs. 500 and 1,000-rupee notes to combat corruption and black money.

description:

♫ Sei To Abar Kachhe Ele ▬ 00:36:14
♫ Aami Agantuk ▬ 00:39:28

Prabodh Chandra Dey (1 May 1919) better known by his nickname Manna Dey, is a playback singer in Hindi, Bengali, Gujarati, Marathi, Malayalam, Kannada, Assamese films. Along with Mohammed Rafi, Kishore Kumar, Mukesh he was a part of Indian film playback music industry. He is rated as the best classical singer among all singers of Hindi film music, though he sang various types of songs from pop to folk. He has recorded more than 3500 songs over the course of his career. The Government of India honored him with the Padma Shri in 1971, the Padma Bhushan in 2005 and the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 2007.
Padmabhusan Manna Dey is a legendary figure in Indian music. His fame is not restricted to the Indian domain only but has over flown to every part of the globe, where an Indian heart resides. In fact his is not merely a name that is deified everywhere, rather it creates a ripple of mixed feeling of love and worship whenever cited. People venerate him not only for his musical bearing but because he epitomizes a wonderful combination of melody and poetry. His stance in Indian music vindicates the axiom -- the art outlives the artist.

title: How India's Villages Are Coping With The Big Note Ban
description:
A week after the notes ban, rural India, a cash-driven economy now starved of cash, is struggling - for seeds to sow, labourers to pay and even to buy food. While many across India's villages are confident that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's move to ban Rs. 500 and Rs. 1000 currency notes will hit the black economy and pay off in the long run, for many others, daily subsistence has become a struggle. On Agenda - villagers of Rabupura in Uttar Pradesh, just over 50 km from the national capital - make their views heard.

Srikanto Acharya is a Kolkata-based modern Bengali singer-songwriter and music director.Srikanto was born in Kolkata, India and is son of Rohini Nandan Acharya and Kana Acharya. He got formal training in music from Dakshinee. He also got trained in tabla from Ustad Ali Ahmed Khan. He quit his job as a sales professional and then Utpal Chakravarty, proprietor of an old music store convinced him to drop in his cassettes at Sagarika Music. He got a call from them within a week and they offered him a contract to sing for them.

title: BookMyChotu: Rs 90 An Hour To Stand In ATM Line For You
description:
Indian startup Bookmychotu.com has expanded its service portfolio and now provides its customers with a 'helper' to stand in long ATM queues for them. This 'helper' will stand in the queues for Rs 90 per hour on behalf of the customer. This service has caught the attention of many users since long ATM queues are an everyday affair, thanks to the cash crunch caused by the demonetisation of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 currency notes earlier this month.

title: Will India get access to Pathankot mastermind?
description:
In a surprise move, Pakistan has agreed to let a team of Indian investigators to go across to carry out their own investigations into the Pathankot attacks. This after they were presented a lot of evidence by India. Unfortunately, China, apparently at the behest of ally Pakistan, continues to thwart efforts by India to name Masood Azhar a terrorist and ban him. This, even as the Chinese President said in the US, "the terrorist threat is on the rise." Pakistan, meanwhile, has not accepted so far that Masood Azhar was indeed involved in Pathankot.

title: Pakistan Terror Attack: Mujahideen Regiment involved in Kashmir attack
description:
J&K LoC Terror Attack: In an audacious and provocative attack, Pakistani troops entered Indian territory along the Line of Control in the Poonch sector in Jammu and Kashmir late last night and ambushed a patrol killing five Indian soldiers.According to sources, 15-20 Pakistani soldiers of 101 Mujahideen Regiment, aided by a few terrorists, attacked the Sarla post on the Indian side of the LoC.

Pakistani security officials denied any involvement in the deaths of Indian soldiers on the disputed and heavily militarised border in Kashmir. "There was no indiscriminate firing from our side," one security official told Reuters.

Giving details, an Indian Army officer said the patrol had lost contact with the Army unit around 0115 hours, close to the time of the attack."We sent a patrol to the area around 0530 hours today and found five jawans dead with gunshot wounds. One was injured and he is in utter shock," he said.The bodies have been brought back to unit area, he said.

Asked whether Pakistan's Border Action Team (BAT) was involved in the attack, he said it was carried out by the troops of 2 PoK Brigade, which is deployed in that sector.

title: Limit To Swap Old Notes For New Drops To Rs. 2,000 from Rs. 4,500
description:
Families can withdraw Rs. 2.5 lakh for weddings from one account and farmers can withdraw up to Rs. 25,000 a week, the government said today, announcing another set of measures to ease a massive cash crunch after the currency ban. The limit for swapping notes at banks has been reduced from Rs. 4,500 to Rs. 2,000 for each person.

title: 4 terrorists dead, surviving ones may have escaped Pathankot Air Base
description:
The terrorists who had holed up at Pathankot air base and were engaging the forces in gun-battle have apparently managed to sneak out, army sources told NDTV. The terror attack, on since 3.30 am, has claimed the lives of three soldiers. Four terrorists have died. It is not known how many were involved in the attack.

title: Note Ban U-Turns: Dent In RBI's Credibility?
description:
There have been 60 changes in rules in just over 40 days following demonetisation. Rules governing the exchange of old notes have been changed five times, rules governing withdrawal limits have been changed six times, those governing the use of old notes have been changed eight times. But it's the latest flip-flop by the RBI that has attracted maximum criticism - they said multiple deposits of over 5,000 rupees would attract questions and then did a turnaround after a massive outcry. The opposition is now alleging that the central bank has lost all semblance of being an autonomous institution. Is the attack on the RBI justified?

title: Baby Dies After Hospital Allegedly Refuses To Take 500, 1,000 Rupee Notes
description:
For Jagadish and Kiran Sharma, residents of Mumbai's Govandi area, the effect of the government's radical move to withdraw 500 and 1,000 rupee notes from circulation, has not just been bothersome but utterly devastating. The couple lost their newborn baby after allegedly being turned away by a private hospital in Govandi just because they did not have enough usable cash to make the deposit.

title: Black Money Turns White: Why Economist Jagdish Bhagwati Says That's Good
description:
Around 37,000 crores have been deposited in Jan Dhan accounts since demonetisation. These deposits have raised concern of black money being laundered using these accounts. Renowned economist Jagdish Bhagwati however feels that's not a cause for concern as that money is benefitting the poor. Speaking to NDTV from Columbia University, Mr Bhagwati said don't call this corruption but treat it like an amnesty scheme.

title: Rs 1000 and Rs 500 Will Not Be Legal from Midnight, Says PM Modi
description:
PM Narendra Modi announces that currency notes of Rs 1000 and Rs 500 will not be legal tender from November 10 midnight. Modi government takes such bold step to curb black money, corruption and fake currency and terrorism.
People can exchange or submit 500 rupee and 1000 rupee notes in the banks and post offices. Soon government will launch new currency notes of 500 and 2000.

title: Remembering Geeta Dutt | Bengali Movie Songs Jukebox | Geeta Dutt Songs
description:
Tune Your Favourite Song ::

♪ Tumi Je Amar ▬  00:00

♪ Ei Mayabi Tithi ▬  26:04
♪ Shudhu Ekbar Bole Jao ▬  29:33

About The Artist ::

Geeta Dutt came from a wealthy family. Her father Devendrananth Roy Chowdhary was the richest man in his area. Her mother had a fondness for the fine arts. Geeta was the only one of their ten children who was inclined towards music and singing. Her mother loved music and she encouraged Geeta to learn. A tutor was employed and as a schoolgirl Geeta diligently practised her singing for several hours every day. 
She was a born singer and she just had to hear a tune once in order to start humming it and then render it perfectly.

title: Life Without 500 and 1000 Rs: The Good, Bad and Ugly
description:
On Prime Time, we take a look at how the country is living through the absence of 500 and 1000 Rupee currency notes which the government pulled out on Wednesday. With a massive scarcity of currency to perform large transactions, how are wholesale markets continuing to trade? Why are traders afraid of performing electronic transactions? Now on the other hand there is also one section of the population that has a genuine need to stock money in the form of currency notes and does not want to save it in banks. Who are they? Watch the episode to know. (Audio in Hindi)

title: Tumi O Ami | Rabindra Sangeet | Bengali Songs | Audio Jukebox | Tanjina Toma
description:
Tanjina Toma is one of the popular Tagore singers of Bangladesh today, lauded by the young  generation, She was trained in Chayanaut (Bangladesh), the foremost  and most coveted music institutions of Bangladesh.Toma knows how to interpret Tagore’s creations in her own unique  mystical style.  Her expressions with openness  as Tagore’s sky has won the hearts of many in the contemporary days. Toma is a senior grade artiste of Bangladesh 
National Radio (Bangladesh Betar) and Bangladesh Television. Besides, she performs regularly in Live programme sin almost all private TV channels of Bangladesh. Her songs have been screened in Tara Muzik in Kolkata where she performed in Ajj Shokaler Amontroney.Her gurus included such exponents as late Wahidul Haqueand  DrSanjidaKhatun. As a successful student of Chayanaut (Bangladesh), she received the opportunity to  teach there as a  senior faculty member which she has been doing for the last ten years in the Department of Rabindrasangeet. Besides, in her professional domain, she is also a faculty member  in another first ranking secondary school, called Scholastica. Thus, Toma has blended science, music and her deeper sensitivity to Tagore’s philosophical rhythm that transcends his all works related to music.

This album "TUMI O AMI" is  a selection of 10  Tagore songs from Nature and Prem reflecting the philosophies of Tagore in various human emotions. Which will surely be liked and appreciated by the music lovers.

title: Pancham Tumi Kothay | Asha Bhosle’s Tribute to R.D. Burman | Bengali Songs Audio JukeBox
description:
Listen to ‘Pancham Tumi Kothay’ by the most vivacious, versatile, timeless artist Asha Bhosle.
The album comprises of 8 super hit Bengali tracks handpicked by Asha Ji, previously composed and sung by R.D. Burman. All the 8 tracks have been re-arranged by Nitin Shankar and sung by the living legend Asha Bhosle. 
The entire album is re-arranged by using live musical instruments unlike the latest trend where the entire music is programmed on keyboard. The live instrumentation gives a very vibrant feel to the tracks complementing Asha Bhosle’s evergreen dynamic voice. 
Music is re-arranged by Percussionist Nitin Shankar an ardent R.D. Burman fan and an early enthusiast of music. Nitin Shankar is known for creating various different sounds from octapads and conga which also became a regular fixture in Pancham's rhythm sections. 

Album :: Pancham Tumi Kothay: Asha Bhosle's Tribute To R.D.Burman
Singer :: Asha Bhosle

Manabendra Mukhopadhyay (Bengali: মানবেন্দ্র মুখোপাধ্যায়) was a Bengali singer and composer. It is considered that during the 1950s, 60s and 70s the Bengali modern songs reached its peak of excellence and that period is usually called the "Golden age of Bengali Adhunik Songs". At that time Bengal had a unique mix of singers which inspired composers and lyricists to create innumerable treasure of creative music. Each singer had his own inimitable style and compositions were made to match their individual ability. Bengali non-film modern songs were in fact was as popular, if not more, than film songs which also reached a level of popularity in the 50s and 60s.

title: Amid Currency Crunch, E-Wallets Cash In
description:
As people seek more options to go cashless, the mobile phone is slowly becoming the new wallet. It is helping even men like Harishankar Pandey, a pan shop owner in Delhi, with customers using apps and e-wallets to make small value transactions. "This is very practical. On an average, about 20-25 persons use apps like Paytm, Swiggy every day," said Mr Pandey. It is the reason even customers like Kunal Kalra and Ranajit Mukherjee aren't worried about counting the currency in their wallets before making buying decisions.

Tomay Hrid Majhare Rakhibo Chere Debona is  a Bengali Traditional Folk Song written by Dwij Bhushan and Music by Vaishnav Kirtan. Many Bengali Singer sung the song soulfully.  Lopamudra Mitra, Bolepur Bluez, Laxman Das, Gautam Das baul, Akriti Kakar has also sung the song in their own  way. tomay hrid majhare rakhbo , chhhere dibona

description:
The DRI has seized Rs 2.60 crore cash, including Rs 12 lakh in new notes, and 95kg of gold and silver in connection with its probe into alleged diversion of duty-free gold worth about Rs 140 crore, imported under a special concession scheme, by a firm operating from a Noida-based SEZ.

title: Haqikat Kya Hai: How to Convert Black Money into White
description:
Haqikat Kya Hai: How to convert black money into white. Peoples want to exchange and deposit Rs 500 and Rs 1000 currency notes. 
Modi government has banned Rs 500 and Rs 1000 currency notes to curb black money, fake currency, terrorism funding.
Peoples are also trying to convert their black money into white by buying gold and exchanging to other currency. Old notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 found floating in river Ganga and dustbins and also burnt.

title: Entire Village Assembles to Pay Tribute to Uri Martyr Raj Kishore Singh
description:
Raj Kishore Singh, martyred in Uri attacks was cremated in his native village of Arrah in Bihar. The entire village had assembled to pay their tributes to Singh who had been battling for his life at a hospital for over ten days.

title: Superhit Romantic Bengali Film Songs | Lata Mangeshkar | Kishore Kumar | Manna Dey | Asha Bhosle
description:
Superhit Bengali Film Songs by  Lata Mangeshkar, Kishore Kumar, Manna Dey and Asha Bhosle.  An all star collective for Bengali Modern Songs. This compilation contains some of the legend’s Superhit Bengali Film Songs, some of which are compositions of the great maestro R. D. Burman. 
Lata Mangeshkar is one of the best-known and most respected playback singers in India. Her songs became a smashing hit among listeners of all age groups.
Asha Bhosle, commonly known as Ashaji, is not only a playback singer in Hindi cinema but also in Bengali Cinema.
Apart from Film songs, Kishore Kumar also sang various genres including Modern Bengali Songs. He is considered one of the most successful & greatest playback singers of Modern Bengali Songs. 
Manna Dey is another great Modern Bengali singer who has lent his voice for one of the tracks in this compilation. Manna Dey is known for his extra ordinary crooning abilities and super melodious voice. 
This album is a compilation of some of the most Superhit Bengali Film Songs. These Bengali Songs are sung by legends like Lata Mangeshkar, Kishore Kumar, Manna Dey and Asha Bhosle. Especially songs like “Aamar Swapna Je” and “Phool Koli Re Phool Koli” have become a household name with the Bengali masses. This one is a legendary compilation where these evergreen Bengali Film Songs are rendered by these maestros.

title: Demonetisation Could Pave The Way For More RBI Rate Cuts: Rajeev Malik
description:
Rajeev Malik, senior economist at CLSA, said demonetisation could have a deflationary impact on the Indian economy but it could pave the way for more RBI rate cuts. He expects the RBI to cut repo rate three times in the next 12 months, including one next month.

title: BJP Attributes Gujarat, Maharashtra Local Body Polls Victories To Demonetisation
description:
On Prime Time, we cover the latest events following the demonetisation move by the government and its effects on the population as well as on curbing black money. After its victories in the local body elections held in Gujarat and Maharashtra immediately after the demonetisation move, the BJP says that it is a reflection of people's support to the government's actions against black money. (Audio in Hindi)

Watch full video: http://khabar.ndtv.com/video/show/prime-time/are-public-happy-with-bjp-on-demonetisation-issue-440667?yt

title: Halla Bol | July 2, 2016 | ISIS Plans To Attack India Through Bangladesh
description:
Islamic State has made its intentions clear of launching terror attacks in India through its bases in Bangladesh and Pakistan.
In an interview with the group's online magazine Dabiq in April, Shaykh Abu Ibrahim Al-Hanif, 'Amir of Khilafah in Bengal' said that once the group manages to build bases in Bangladesh, it will launch raids in east and west of India.

title: After day-long gun-battle in Pathankot, 4 terrorists dead
description:
After more than 13 hours, guns finally fell silent at Punjab's Pathankot air base. Following a pitched battle through the day, backed by attack helicopters and state-of-the-art equipment, the security forces had wrested control of the compound. All four terrorists were dead. The security forces sustained three casualties -- including one Air Force Garud commando.

title: How Black Money Will Be Taxed: Government's New Proposal
description:
With the ban on 500 and 1,000-rupee notes now more than two weeks old, the government has proposed new rules to tax black money that is being unearthed. The bill was submitted today for parliament's review by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley as the government is being attacked by a united opposition over its sudden withdrawal of 86 per cent of the notes in circulation to check black money and corruption. The move has plunged the country, especially rural India, into a major cash shortage.

title: For Farmers In UP Hinterland, A Desperate Wait For New Notes To Arrive
description:
At a government-run warehouse at Barabanki, 30 km from Uttar Pradesh's capital Lucknow, 23-year-old Lav Kush is one of the few farmers who has turned up with enough usable currency for two sacks of fertiliser. This fertiliser is critical for the potato crop that he's just sowed on his two acre-field. He'll need more fertiliser soon, but Lav Kush is already out of cash.

title: Best of Nazrul Geeti by Firoza Begum | Manabendra Mukherjee Bengali Songs
description:
Nazrul Geeti is a genre of Bengali Songs that originates from the works of the great rebel poet Kazi Nazrul Islam. Nazrul Geeti that literally translates to be songs of Nazrul is an integral part of Bengali culture. This compilation of Nazrul Geeti has some of the greatest Nazrul Geeti artists like Feroza Begum and Manabendra Mukherjee. Firoza Begum happened to be a direct disciple of Kazi Nazrul Islam. Feroza Begum is renowned for her Gazal Gayaki and Nazrul is the first Bengali composer who introduced Gazal in Bengali Songs. Manabendra Mukherji on the other hand is one of the greatest Bengali playback singers. But his fondness for Nazrul Geeti made him record several Nazrul Geeti records and thus made Manabendra Mukherji a house hold name when it came to Nazrul Geeti artists.

Kazi nazrul Islam who is fondly remembered as “Nazrul” or the “Bidrohi Kobi” (literally means the rebellious poet) was born in the village of Churulia in the Burdwan district which is in West Bengal now.  Kazi Nazrul Islam created an avant-garde genre of modern Bengali Songs. He wrote and composed these songs himself. This entire genre was termed later on as Nazrul Geeti or songs of Kazi Nazrul Islam. Nazrul wrote and composed music for his nearly 4,000 songs.

Kazi Nazrul Islam was highly motivated by the nationalist freedom movements and preached revolution through his poetic works, such as Bidrohi (The Rebel) and Bhangar Gaan (The Song of Destruction), as well as his publication Dhumketu (The Comet). He was hailed captive by the British Raaj many a times. Kazi Nazrul Islam fiercely inspired Bengalis during the Bangladesh Liberation War. Nazrul is held as the national poet of Bangladesh. 
This assorted compilation of Nazrul Geeti has some of the most popular Nazrul songs sung by some of the greatest artists, many of whom were direct disciples of Kazi Nazrul Islam. Nazrul became the first person to introduce Islam into the larger mainstream tradition of Bengali music. Nazrul also composed some notable Shyama Sangeet, Kirtan and Bhajan which were essentially Hindu art forms. He was deeply influenced by the Arabic and Persian melodies. Which reflects mainly through his compositions. This compilation has songs sung by Feroza Begum, Suprava Sarkar and Sachin Dev Burman who were all direct disciples of Kazi Nazrul Islam. Songs like Koohu Koohu Koyelia and Rum Jhuma Rum Jhuma are a classic example of Kazi Nazrul Islam's profound compositional knowledge. With some of the biggest names in Nazrul Geeti this compilation “Assorted Songs Of Kazi Nazrul Islam” is a must have.

== Songs in this Album ==

All Lyric & Composition: Kazi Nazrul Islam

► Kaberi Nadi Jaley - Suprava Sarkar  0:00:01 
► Koohu Koohu Koyelia - Sachin Dev Burman 0:03:33
► Piu Piu Bale Papiya - Purabi Dutta 0:07:01
► Chaitali Chandini - Dhirendra Chandra Mitra 0:09:51

title: Pakistan on Pathankot Terror Attack: Working on 'Leads' Provided by India
description:
Pakistan is working on the "leads" provided by India on the terror attack on the IAF base in Pathankot, the Foreign Office said tonight in a statement whose tone was conciliatory.

Extending Pakistan's deepest condolences to the Government and people of India on the "unfortunate terrorist incident" in Pathankot, a statement by the spokesperson of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said, "We understand the pain of many families who have lost their dear ones in this tragedy, as Pakistan itself is a major victim of terrorism."

Noting that the terror attack that left seven security personnel dead has been categorically condemned by Pakistan, the spokesperson said, "In line with Pakistan's commitment to effectively counter and eradicate terrorism, the Government is in touch with the Indian government and is working on the leads provided by it."

title: Akshay Kumar Gets Angry over Pathankot Terror Attacks, Says Terrorists Shouldn’t be Spared
description:
Actor Akshay Kumar who is gearing for his next release, ‘Airlift’ has condemned the attacks on Indian Air Force Base in Pathankot strongly. The attack by terrorists started on Saturday, in which seven soldiers died serving our motherland.

Speaking at a press conference this evening, Akshay Kumar said that looking at these incidents all he wishes to do is kill the terrorists.

“It is very unfortunate that so our soldiers die. See I am not a real hero, I am real one. With my movies be it Baby, Gabbar is Back or Holiday, I try my level best to depict what happens in the lives of the families of our soldiers,” Akshay said.

“There is no such formula, except Bhaiiya andar ghus ke maaro (Get inside and execute them). Nothing else,” a furious Akshay said.

On Hum Log, amidst all the bickering over demonetization, comedians Neeti Palta, Raju Srivastav and RJ Naved bring out the humour in the situation. Some of the participants in the show say they faced problems at hospitals or other institutions that flouted government rules and turned them away because they didn't have the new currency notes. Should the government be answerable to the problems being faced by people due to cash crunch or should we treat these issues as hiccups following the implementation of a policy that will help India in the long run? title: Note Ban Shock Is Good For India: Nandan Nilekani To NDTV
description:
Nandan Nilekani, who shaped the world's largest biometric database with India's Aadhaar project, is confident that the government's ban on 500 and 1,000 rupee notes will ensure financial inclusion surges. Mr Nilekani, co-founder of IT giant Infosys, predicated digital transactions will escalate considerably in the next 3-6 months to a rate that would otherwise have taken "3 to 6 years." Mr Nilekani said that any short-term contraction in economic growth will be compensated for very quickly "with digitization."

Aadhaar, which assigns a unique identity (UID) to every citizen linked to their biometrics, is key to helping rural India open zero-balance or Jan Dhan bank accounts and to avail of direct cash transfers to the poor through welfare schemes.

In 2014, Mr Nilekani ran unsuccessfully for parliament as a Congress candidate from Bengaluru.

"The credit for creating the Aadhaar system goes to the UPA government, Dr Manmohan Singh," said Mr Nilekani, referring to the former Prime Minister. "At the same time, am grateful to PM Modi because he has taken what was built and applied it to so many schemes...this government took it forward," he said about how the Aadhaar project has been increasingly utilized. 

"A lot will depend on the next three months. If they accelerate digitization... long-term, it will be a very good development," he said.

title: Always Paid In Cash, Bengal Tea Garden Workers Open First Bank Accounts
description:
The cash ban has hit the livelihood of tea garden workers in north Bengal. Their salaries were paid in cash earlier, but after the currency ban, the centre's labour department has insisted that bank accounts be opened for tea garden workers. From Sunday, banks have set up camps at tea gardens and in one such camp, 300 accounts were opened in just three days.

Lata Mangeshkar (born 28 September 1929) is an Indian singer-songwriter. She is one of the best-known and most respected playback singers in India.Mangeshkar's career started in 1942 and has spanned over six and a half decades. She has recorded songs for over a thousand Hindi films and has sung songs in over thirty-six regional Indian languages and foreign languages, though primarily in Hindi. She is the elder sister of singer Asha Bhosle, Hridayanath Mangeshkar, Usha Mangeshkar and Meena Mangeshkar. She is the second vocalist to have ever been awarded the Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian honour.

title: Delhi on High Alert after Pathankot Terror Attacks
description:
Delhi on high alert after Pathankot terror attacks.

Till now seven Jawans of India including Subedar Fateh Singh, Gursewak Singh and Lieutenant Colonel Niranjan Kumar have lost their lives in an operation in Pathankot. 

Defense Minister Manohar Parrikar meets Prime Minister Narendra Modi and briefs him about the attack. An attack helicopter was seen opening firing inside the Pathankot Air Force station.

Four terrorists killed in terror attack at Pathankot Air Force Station in Punjab. Pathankot is a key air base for MiG-21 Bison fighters and Mi-35 attack helicopters, located 50 kilometers from Indo-Pak border. The suspected terrorists belong to Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror outfit.

About Puthiya Thalaimurai TV

 Puthiya Thalaimurai TV (Tamil: புதிய தலைமுறை டிவி) is a 24x7 live news channel in Tamil launched on August 24, 2011.Due to its independent editorial stance it became extremely popular in India and abroad within days of its launch and continues to remain so till date.The channel looks at issues through the eyes of the common man and serves as a platform that airs people's views.The editorial policy is built on strong ethics and fair reporting methods that does not favour or oppose any individual, ideology, group, government, organisation or sponsor.The channel’s primary aim is taking unbiased and accurate information to the socially conscious common man.
 
Besides giving live and current information the channel broadcasts news on sports,  business and international affairs. It also offers a wide array of week end programmes.
 
The channel is promoted by Chennai based New Gen Media Corporation. The company also publishes popular Tamil magazines- Puthiya Thalaimurai and Kalvi.
 
The news center is based in Chennai city, supported by a sprawling network of bureaus all over Tamil Nadu. It has a northern hub in the capital Delhi.The channel is proud of its well trained journalists and employs cutting edge technology for news gathering and processing.

Hemanta Kumar Mukhopadhyay (16 June 1920 – 26 September 1989), also known as Hemanta Mukherjee, was born in Varanasi who was a Singer, Composer, Music Director and Film Producer in India. He had won two National awards for the category Best Male Playback Singer. He sang in Bengali, Hindi and Marathi, who also sang in several other languages like Gujarati, Assamese, Oriya, Konkani and Bhojpuri. He was one of the foremost exponents of Rabindra Sangeet and perhaps the most sought-after male singer.

title: Remembering Alpana Banerjee | Bengali Song Audio Jukebox | Alpana Banerjee Songs
description:
Songs::
♪ Hattim Attim Tim ▬ 00:00
♪ Bakulgandhe Jodi Batas ▬ 02:59
♪ Chhotto Pakhi Chandana ▬ 05:47
♪ Tarader Chumki Jwale Akashe ▬ 09:15
♪ Moynar Ma Moynamati ▬ 12:01

♪ Mon Bolchhe Aaj Sandhyay ▬ 18:00
♪ Yamunabati Saraswati ▬ 21:13
♪ Abchha Megher Orna Gaye ▬ 23:52
♪ Shiyarer Deep Jodi ▬ 26:56

Alpana Banerjee's major popularity derived from singing children's songs, which she transformed from simple rhymes to immortal classics. Bengalis from the 1950s through the 1990s were raised on Alpana's classics like 'Hattim Attim Tim' or 'Chhotto Pakhi Chandana'.
Her non-children songs also received considerable popularity. One of the earliest and notable Bengali non-film songs sung by Alpana was "Samiran Phire Chao" under Robin Chattopadhyay's baton. Soon after, in 1951, she recorded the song "Matir Ghare Aaj Nemechhe Chand Re" for the Bengali film 'Vidyasagar' with music once again by Robin Chattopadhay. This song became remarkably popular.

title: In Cash Starved Rural Telangana, Farmers Desperate For 'Change'
description:
A week after the notes ban, rural India, a cash-driven economy now starved of cash, is struggling - for seeds to sow, labourers to pay, food to buy and even a cup of tea. After three years of drought, farmers had been looking forward to a good rabi season. The rains have been plentiful, but with no usable money in hand, they are desperate.

title: Remedy To What? Villagers In Bastar Still Learning About Notes Ban
description:
Locals in Gundul village in Bastar's Kanker district were amazed to see the new Rs. 2,000 notes. They had only faintly heard of the currency ban at a nearby market. Sukhdev, a farmer who doubles up as a cook at a government school in this Maoist area in Chhattisgarh, recently gave his life's savings, all of Rs. 11,000 in banned Rs. 500 and Rs. 1,000 notes to an acquaintance to get it exchanged, despite having a Jan Dhan bank account.

title: Rural Service Providers, Traders Adamant on Cash-Only Payments
description:
On Prime Time, we present a ground report from rural areas of Muradnagar in Uttar Pradesh where people who have to host weddings have to make several trips to banks to draw money. The reason is obvious: Traders, caterers and service providers for weddings blindly refuse to accept cheque based payments. When contacted, the tent supplier said that his employees do not want to take cheques. Two weeks after the announcement of demonetization, supply chain in villages continues to be choked because of each individual demanding only cash as payment for their goods and services. (Audio in Hindi)


Watch full video: http://khabar.ndtv.com/video/show/prime-time/where-our-lokpal-is-missing-439913?yt

title: Truth vs Hype: The Great Indian Whitewash
description:
First came the notes ban - Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ambitious move to scrap 500 and 1,000-rupee notes to curb corruption and black money - and now, across the country, raids are in progress as crores in new currency is tumbling out. Many are asking how are these cash hoards possible, given that banks and ATMs seem consistently short of cash? This week, we report on the multiple devious ways in which crores of hoarded cash may have found its way back into the system, and how the raids and seizures may only be the tip of the iceberg.

title: Parliamentary Panel Raps Govt Over Pathankot Terror Attack
description:
A Parliamentary panel today criticised the government and its security agencies for failing to thwart the January 2 Pathankot airbase terror attack despite terror alert being sounded well in advance.
Parliamentary Standing Committee on Home Affairs in its report, presented in the Rajya Sabha, said that something was seriously wrong with counter-terror security establishment. It asked the government to pay attention to effectively sealing the border (with Pakistan) through increased patrolling as well as fencing and floodlighting etc.

title: 13 Hours In Line At Bank, Then A Sleepover, Finally He Got Rs. 10,000
description:
At 10 pm, Baljinder Singh, a senior citizen, is curled up on the pavement outside a state-run bank in the village of Sangrur in Punjab. It is 11 degrees. The night is thick with fog. The 71-year-old farmer covers himself with a shawl. But his home and bed are not a viable option. The winter is only one endurance test. The greater challenge is in getting cash.

title: My Finance Minister Asked Me Not To Rush To Banks, So I Didn't: Yogendra Yadav
description:
Following the withdrawal of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 notes, yet another change in bank deposit rules by the government has left more citizens irked. Latest rules stipulate that any deposit of over Rs 5000 in old currency notes will require an explanation from customers as to why it wasn't done earlier. Political scientist Yogendra Yadav's 'explanation' for a 'small deposit' he made has gone viral - he says he was told there was 'no need to rush to banks', so he took his time because he 'believed' the Finance Minister and the Reserve Bank of India.

title: The Big Fight: Notes Ban, A Big Success Or Massive Failure?
description:
What are some of the questions that have been on everyone's mind this last week - how long will the queues last? How long will this disruption continue? But most importantly, why is it so that while thousands of citizens stand in queues, waiting to withdraw their hard earned money, our television screens flash hoards of new cash being seized from all across the country? Has black money wriggled its way back into the system? As we take stock of the situation, we revisit the six crucial questions we asked in our last episode - Will this lead to windfall gains for the government? What will happen with the banks? Will there be a budget bonanza? Will black money be blacked out? Will the generation of black black money be curtailed in the future? And finally, how long will this disruption continue? As the weeks pass and time closes in on the Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 50-day promise, we see if our experts still hold the same opinion that they did when the PM's scheme was first announced on November 8th.

Watch full video: http://www.ndtv.com/video/news/the-big-fight/the-big-fight-notes-ban-a-big-success-or-massive-failure-442788?yt

title: Endless Shifts. For Those Handling ATMs, The Work Must Go On
description:
At a time when most people are desperate to get cash, Dilip Singh is surrounded by it. Heaps and heaps of it. Mr Singh works at a large cash management company in Okhla, which handles the stocking and maintenance of ATMs for private and state-run banks. When we meet Mr Singh at his office, a vault manager incharge of processing cash, he and his eight member team are busy segregating cash as per ATM distribution routes. "I have only been home for four hours in the last eight days," he said about his extended shifts after the government cancelled the 500 and 1,000 rupee notes last week. "I have to continue working, to be loyal to my company and country in these difficult times."

title: Cash Ban: Will Take Months Before Losses Are Recovered, Say Industrialists
description:
On Prime Time, we speak to industrialists in Ghaziabad who say that they need at least four months before they can recover from the losses they have been suffering after the demonetisation move by the Centre. They say that the workers in their factories need only cash payment and the restrictions imposed on cash withdrawal makes it difficult for them to pay their workers. Additionally, they also say that the demands from enterprises for their products have reduced significantly because businesses in the secondary and tertiary markets have reduced. (Audio in Hindi)

title: Best Of Kishore Kumar | Bengali Songs | Ei to Jiban | Aamaar Naam Antony | Audio Jukebox
description:
Kishore Kumar (Bengali: কিশোর কুমার গাঙ্গুলী; 4 August 1929 – 13 October 1987) was an Indian film playback singer, actor, lyricist, composer, producer, director, screenplay writer and scriptwriter. He is considered one of the most successful playback singers of theHindi film industry. He sang in many Indian languages including Bengali, Hindi, Marathi, Assamese, Gujarati, Kannada, Bhojpuri,Malayalam, Oriya, and Urdu. He has also sung in private albums in several languages especially in Bengali which are as all time classics.He sungs Evergreen bengali songs likes "Mone Pade Sei Sab," "Ei To Jiban" "Aamaar Naam Antony," "Aaj Shubhadiney Jodi," "Karo Keu Naiko Aami," etc. He won 8 Filmfare Awards for Best Male Playback Singer and holds the record for winning the most Filmfare Awards in that category. He was awarded the "Lata Mangeshkar Award" by the Madhya Pradesh government and from that year onwards, the Madhya Pradesh Government initiated a new award called the "Kishore Kumar Award" for contributions to Hindi cinema.
Kishore Kumar was born in a Bengali Ganguly family in Khandwa, Central Provinces and Berar (now in Madhya Pradesh) as Abhas Kumar Ganguly. His father Kunjalal Ganguly (Gangopadhyay) was a lawyer and his mother Gouri Devi came from a wealthy Bengali family. Kunjalal Gangopadhyaya was invited by the Kamavisadar Gokhale family of Khandwa to be their personal lawyer. Kishore was the youngest of four siblings, the other three were Ashok (the eldest), Sati Devi, and Anoop. While Kishore was still a child, his brother Ashok became a Bollywood actor. Later, Anoop also ventured into cinema with Ashok's help. Spending time with his brothers, Kishore became interested in films and music. He became a fan of singer-actor K. L. Saigal—whom he considered his guru, and tried to emulate his singing style.

Songs List
1. Aaha Ki Darun Dekhtey - আহা কি দারুন দেখতে 00:00

4. Mone Pade Sei Sab - মনে পড়ে সেই সব 11:49
5. Naari Charitra Bejaay Jatil - নারী চরিত্র বেজায় জটিল 15:20
6. Aamaar Naam Antony - আমার নাম ত্রনটনি 18:04
7. O Amar Sajani Go - ও আমার সজনী গো 21:57
8. Aami Ekjon Saanto Sishto - আমি একজন শান্ত শিষ্ট 28:15
9. Aaj Shubhadiney Jodi - আজ শুভদিনে যদি 31:33
10. Karo Keu Naiko Aami - কারো কেউ নইকো আমি 36:30
